name: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Appellant, v. Simon PIRELA, Appellee

pin_cites.parenthetical: when Post Conviction Relief Act court's findings are supported by substantial evidence and legal conclusion is not clearly erroneous, determination petitioner is mentally retarded and cannot be executed is affirmed

when Post Conviction Relief Act court's findings are supported by substantial evidence and legal conclusion is not clearly erroneous, determination petitioner is mentally retarded and cannot be executed is affirmed

parties: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Appellant, v. Simon PIRELA, Appellee.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
AND NOW, this 20th day of August, 2007, the order of the Court of Common Pleas is affirmed. See Commonwealth v. Gibson, 592 Pa. 411, 925 A.2d 167 (2007) (when Post Conviction Relief Act court’s findings are supported by substantial evidence and legal conclusion is not clearly erroneous, determination petitioner is mentally retarded and cannot be executed is affirmed).
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

attorneys: ' Amy Zapp, Esq., Hugh J. Burns, Jr., Esq., Philadelphia District Attorney’s Office, for Commonwealth of Pennsylvania.
George Gabriel Gordon, Esq., Dechert L.L.P., Philadelphia, for Simon Pirela.
casebody.head_matter:
929 A.2d 629
COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Appellant, v. Simon PIRELA, Appellee.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Submitted April 18, 2005.
Aug. 20, 2007.
' Amy Zapp, Esq., Hugh J. Burns, Jr., Esq., Philadelphia District Attorney’s Office, for Commonwealth of Pennsylvania.
George Gabriel Gordon, Esq., Dechert L.L.P., Philadelphia, for Simon Pirela.
